definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: Rivers and lakes might dry up in some places, and glaciers might melt.
sentences.chinese: 某些地方的河川跟湖泊可能干涸，冰河也可能溶化。

sentences.english: Soil is rock, plus heat, or glacier crushing.
sentences.chinese: 土地是岩石加上热，或冰河的冲压。

sentences.english: Running water and flowing glacial ice are recognized as principal agents of physical erosion.
sentences.chinese: 流水与冰河的流动，被认为是物理侵蚀最主要的营力。

sentences.english: Their seaward edges are speeding up, and the ice sheet behind them is thinning.
sentences.chinese: 冰河正在向海的前缘加速移动，后方的冰原则在变薄。

sentences.english: Could a super-volcano erupt and bring on the next ice age?
sentences.chinese: 超级火山有没有可能爆炸，并引发下个冰河时期？

sentences.english: The Underground Glacier, is located on the northern part of East Jiaodebu mountain. The glacier was formed 10,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 地下冰河，位于东焦得布山北侧，冰河形成于万年前。

sentences.english: The Underground Glacier, is located on the northern part of East Jiaodebu mountain. The glacier was formed 10,000 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 地下冰河，位于东焦得布山北侧，冰河形成于万年前。

sentences.english: Cameron is visiting the Norwegian glacier to see the effects of climate change.
sentences.chinese: 卡麦隆正前往挪威各冰河以观察气候变迁的影响。

sentences.english: Erek Paxton: The scenario begins 350 years into the Age of Ice.
sentences.chinese: 这个剧情开始于350年进入的冰河世纪。

sentences.english: By comparison The Little Ice Age pales .
sentences.chinese: 小冰河时期的影响并不大。

sentences.english: Now let's come back to the topic about Ice Age again.
sentences.chinese: 现在让我们再回到冰河期的话题上吧。

sentences.english: By that time, Finland will probably have been through another ice age.
sentences.chinese: 到那时，芬兰可能已经度过了另一个冰河时期。

sentences.english: And those plants may have caused the next great ice age.
sentences.chinese: 那些植物可能导致了下一次大冰河期的到来。

sentences.english: How come a big ice age happened when carbon dioxide levels were high?
sentences.chinese: 在大冰河期，二氧化碳含量水平怎么会高呢？

sentences.english: Most of us know that there have ever been Ice Ages on the earth three times.
sentences.chinese: 我们大多数人都知道地球上曾有过三次冰河期。

sentences.english: Newly installed seismometers will listen for glacial earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 新安装的地震仪将可监听冰河地震的声音。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
a world of ice and snow
to freeze over (of water or land)
